item.title: Resume
item.description: My professional skills Software tester - developlemnt of unit and automated integration tests Desing, implementation and maintenance of services and computer networks Linux developer and user IT security priciples aware in area of software development and service operation Good communication skills in written and spoken form Languages: English (fluent), German (fluent), Swiss German (good comprehension), Slovak (native) My technology exprience Programing languages Python - experienced Java - experienced Bash - experienced golang - basics Ruby - basics Programing frameworks and technologies Apache Kafka Java Spring Cloud Stream Java Spring Boot JUnit Selenium test automation Python Flask and Django framework Computer networks Understanding of various carrier network setups Routing OSPF, BGP Switching on ethernet Network configuration and troubleshooting on various vendors and on Linux Miscalanous Development of configuration management using Ansible Software packaging using Docker Deployemnt of of an application on Kubernetes cluster Development of automation pipelines on Jenkins and Gitlab CI Monitoring setup with Prometheus, Icinga, Smokeping Git - daily driver, often using the CLI commands regular expressions GPG *also with smartcards” setup HDD encryption with LUKS setup LIR technical administration experience IDE: Pycharm Editor: vim, neovim Work experience Test automation engineer at Swisscom in Zürich, Switzerland March 2019 - present Development of automated integration tests for software components and network appliance Development of unit tests for software components Development of a microservice application on Apache Kafka Streams DevOps engineer at Swisscom in Zürich, Switzerland September 2018 - February 2019 Operation of a cloud service for data storage Development of a configuration management with Ansible System DevOps engineer at Securosys SA in Zürich, Switzerland September 2017 - March 2018 Development of infrastructure for a HSM as a service Infrastructure design, implementation, operation and setup of monitoring tools Work mainly with FOSS tools Network manager at Bühler group in Uzwil, Switzerland September 2014 - August 2017 Change and incident management in global network infrastructure with more than 3k active network devices and 10k users Making work easier to manage by developing Python scripts, Ansible playbooks and deployment pipelines on GitLab Vendors: Cisco, Riverbed, Microsoft Implementation project manager at HP Enterprise services in Bratislava, Slovakia July 2011 - June 2014 Responsible for implementation of various network changes for enterprise customers Vendors: Cisco, HP, F5, Checkpoint Network support specialist at Soitron for EU commission secure network sTesta in Bratislava, Slovakia March 2008 - June 2011 Firewall management Juniper ISG & SSG BGP implementation engineer Network issue troubleshooter 1st and 2nd level support Education Master's degree - Faculty of Informatics and Information Technologies, Slovak University of Technology in Bratislava, Slovakia (2008 - level C1 Göthe Institut

item.title: Prevent Grep From Showing Up
item.description: Prevent grep from showing up in ‘ps’ output You don't want the grep process itself to show up in the list of process (ps) when filtering with the grep. In the example below, the second line should not appear. $ ps -few | grep nvim vagrant 12337 11456 0 14:55 pts/6 00:00:00 nvim vagrant 12340 4979 0 14:55 pts/3 00:00:00 grep --color=auto nvim How to to achieve it? You can use ‘-v’ or ‘–invert-match’ switch of grep as follows:

item.title: Learning Go
item.description: Learning Go - Notes Notes which I took during my learning. It'd be great if they would also help you. Go is statically written (type of every variable must be defined), pass by value (whenever you pass an argument into a function, Go creates a copy of each argument, and these copies are used inside of the function) programming language. Go workspace and basics MUST READ DOCUMENT Syntax Variable declaration if you define a variable within the if statement(condition) it is valid only there.

item.title: Notes
item.description: This section shows you my various notes about technical topics. I started to take notes some time ago when I could not memorize the stuff. In my case, it really helps and provides me a good reference. I how you find it usefull too. Please note, that this is a evolving page. Notes here may not be well structured and/or formulated. GNU/Linux administration commands and concepts To cancel shutdown shutdown -ci or pkill shutdown

item.title: Contact
item.description: I prefer GPG encrypted emails. inbox@fjanus.eu My GPG key fingerprint 1E28 8B33 06B0 9DC4 33F4 1507 5F7B 978E A457 58B0 My key can be downloaded from the keyserver-pool or from the local copy.

item.title: Welcome
item.description: This is a personal page of Frantisek Janus. I'm IT professional living in Zürich area. The content of this page is focused on technical topics, mainly from my work or about topics which interests me. You can find 2 main content sections here: 1. Notes - intended to be one long document with my quick notes. 2. Blog - posts where I would like to go a little deeper or to be more verbose.
